newsitem.title: USA: U.S. spot gas prices continue to erode on weather.
newsitem.headline: U.S. spot gas prices continue to erode on weather.

text.p: U.S. spot natural gas prices continued to weaken Friday ahead of the holiday weekend and milder temperatures next week, industry sources said.
Louisiana Gulf Coast prices fell another 10 cents to the $2.10-2.15 per million British thermal units range, while prices in south Texas dropped 20 cents to the mid-$1.90s to low-$2 area.
Temperatures are expected to be above-normal throughout most of the U.S. by Tuesday of next week following a brief cold spell in the East on Sunday and Monday.
